title: The Results by Voting District in Tuesday's Primary Election

body: Ten years ago today, New York City's First Deputy Mayor, a ruddy veteran of 40 years in municipal government named James A. Cavanagh, took an action that almost immediately changed the nature of life in the city. He ordered the dismissal of 19,000 civil servants by midnight. The orders clanked their way over teleprinters to 76 police precinct
title: A DECADE AFTER THE CUTBACKS, NEW YORK IS A DIFFERENT CITY

body: WHERE WATER COMES TOGETHER WITH OTHER WATER. By Raymond Carver. 130 pages. Random House. $13.95. WHAT THE LIGHT WAS LIKE. By Amy Clampitt. 110 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. Cloth, $14.95; paper, $8.95. IN three astringent collections of short stories (''Will You Please Be Quiet, Please?'' ''What We Talk About When We Talk About Love'' and ''Cathedral''),
title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES

body: Workers at 11 large cemeteries in the New York City area went on strike yesterday, setting up pickets at cemetery gates as funeral processions rolled in. There appeared to be little initial disruption for mourning families because many graves had been dug in advance. But both the union representing the workers and cemetery officials said that,
title: WORKERS STRIKE AT 11 CEMETERIES IN NEW YORK AREA

body: An 11-year-old boy was shot in a foot Tuesday afternoon while playing in a parking lot at 300 Vernon Avenue, near Sumner Avenue, in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, the police said yesterday. They said that neither the boy, Rafael Cebello of 66 Lewis Avenue, near Hart Avenue, nor an aunt who was with him, Minerva Martinez, had seen who
title: THE CITY; BOY IS SHOT IN FOOT IN PARKING LOT

body: An 8-year-old girl on a playground slide was struck in the neck by a bullet yesterday evening in the East New York section of Brooklyn, the police said. The child, Lakeisha King, of the Cypress Hills housing project, ran to the nearby home of an aunt, who called the Housing Authority police. She was taken to Baptist Medical Center, where she was
title: Girl Is Shot at a Playground

body: Sleight of hand and juggling attract some unlikely practitioners. Take the Rev. Jerry Jecewiz, a priest at St. Finbar's Roman Catholic Church in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn. A member of the International Brotherhood of Magicians, he has put together a show of escape and magic tricks. He donates his fees to a community project for
title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY; The Magician And the Juggler
